example.name: automated_commit_and_tag
example.description: Automatically generate a commit message and create a new tag after merging a PR.
example.context: Triggered after a successful PR merge to main branch.
example.code: <use_mcp_tool> <server_name>github</server_name> <tool_name>create_and_submit_pull_request_review</tool_name> <arguments> { "owner": "example-org", "repo": "example-repo", "pullNumber": 123, "body": "Automated review: All checks passed. Merging.", "event": "APPROVE" } </arguments> </use_mcp_tool> <execute_command> <command>git tag v1.2.0</command> </execute_command>
example.explanation: This example demonstrates how the mode reviews and merges a PR, then tags the new release automatically.

example.name: github_actions_creation
example.description: Create or update a GitHub Actions workflow for CI/CD.
example.context: Triggered when a new workflow requirement is detected.
example.code:
<use_mcp_tool> <server_name>github</server_name> <tool_name>create_or_update_file</tool_name> <arguments> { "owner": "example-org", "repo": "example-repo", "branch": "main", "path": ".github/workflows/ci.yml", "content": "name: CI
on: [push]
jobs:
 build:
 runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 steps:
 - uses: actions/checkout@v2
 - name: Run tests
 run: pytest", "message": "Automated: Add CI workflow" } </arguments> </use_mcp_tool>
example.explanation: This example demonstrates automated creation or update of a workflow file for continuous integration.
